content:
the Observer is a studentrun daily print  online newspaper serving Notre Dame Saint Marys  Holy Cross PERIOD Learn about us PERIOD

Liz Harter  Thursday November  

A group of students in the Notre Dame marching band will have the chance to experience other cultures this summer on a twoweek trip to China and Japan PERIOD

Every other year members of the bands concert ensembles travel internationally to represent the University and play concerts in nationally acclaimed concert halls PERIOD Past destinations have included Scandinavia Australia Austria and the Czech Republic PERIOD

The students will perform at several universities and have time to interact with local students said Tina Durski the senior administrative assistant for the marching band PERIOD

Durski estimated that  to  students will go but said that number is not yet determined PERIOD

The tour begins in Beijing with concerts at the Beijing Concert Hall and the National Academy of Chinese Theater Arts PERIOD The band will then travel to Xian Shanghai and Tokyo PERIOD

The band has also arranged for participants to tour historical sites and experience cultural activities in both countries PERIOD Band members will be able to attend an aerobatic show and tour the factory that manufactures terracotta warriors and horses in China PERIOD They will also try meals like dumpling and traditional duck banquet PERIOD

Band fundraising will finance the trip though students will be asked to help pay Durski said PERIOD

Prospective participants are going through an application process PERIOD They find out this month if they are accepted to the program Durski said PERIOD

Band members said they were interested in making the trip PERIOD

I applied because it seems like such a fun trip said junior Katie Putz who plays the saxophone PERIOD

Fellow saxophone player and junior Matt Meinig called the trip a remarkable once in a lifetime opportunity. not only would I get to travel but I would get to chance to play at some amazing venues he said PERIOD

While the overall experience is what attracts Meinig the most if selected for the trip he would like to see historical sites in the countries PERIOD

If I had to pick one site it would probably have to be the Great Wall because it is so iconic of China he said PERIOD



Share This Story

Senior Michael Daly submitted an application to medical school but said he did not.. PERIOD
